[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The XML Services (XS) defines requirements for data management, schema design, and interoperability within DII.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: XS supports XML-based data handling, schema generation, validation, and document registration.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: XS integrates with DII systems and external databases.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: XS provides web and interactive interfaces for developers and admins.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: XS runs on compliant military-standard hardware for secure operations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: XS interfaces with DBMS and XML parsers for structured data processing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: XS uses secure TCP/IP protocols for encrypted data exchange.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: The system optimizes memory use for high-volume XML processing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: XS ensures 24/7 availability with redundancy and fallback support.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: The system is configurable for diverse deployment environments.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: XS connects with registries and schema validation tools for metadata management.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: XS provides XML registry, validation, schema processing, and data management.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Users include developers, administrators, and military personnel managing XML data.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: XS requires compliant hardware and stable network infrastructure for full operation.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: XS depends on DBMS, TCP/IP, and DII standards for compliance.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Schema: Defines XML elements and attributes.
Registry: Stores XML tags and metadata.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall interface with DBMS for XML registry and schema storage.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall integrate with external registries for metadata exchange.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall provide configurable session timeouts for degraded communication states (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall support hierarchical tag views for XML structures.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall offer batch and interactive XML validation.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process schema validation requests within 5 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support up to 100 concurrent user sessions.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store registered XML schemas, metadata, and validation results (REQ-FUNC-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall implement role-based access control and version tracking.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with DII COE architectural guidelines and follow modular design principles for scalability.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with MIL-STD-498 for software documentation.
[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-002: The system shall adhere to ISO/IEC 9070 for XML identifier standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log all registry and validation activities for auditing.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall support scaling for increasing XML processing workloads.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Functional, performance, and compliance testing for XML processing and DII standards.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Setup documentation, user guides, and XML validation tools.
[SEC] 5. References: MIL-STD-498, ISO/IEC 9070, and TCP/IP networking protocols.
